column4: Can anyone give me a tutorial how do install dotnet framework?
Why not just install monodevelop?
how? apt-get install monodevelop
Im trying to install a program that gives me error because i dont have dotnet framework .exe
well, .NET framework would have to be installed through WINE since it's not a linux app and monodevelop is the equivalent of visual studio .NET
so I juse monodevelop instead of .NET
that is what I would use instead
how do I use it? Still when I run wine setup.exe I get the error "dotnetfx35setup.exe cannot be verified" or sometging like that
I have not installed .NET through wine so you will need to get help from people that have developed .NET applications in WINE, sorry
do you find it in the gnome or kde menu?
Okok, but can you recommend another way to install my program since it complain about an error since I dont have the dodnetfx35setup
just read some quick information on .NET in ubuntu and compatibility is poor in WINE and not recommended
take a look at other alternatives such as monodevelop, mono, or eclipse
yeah I have installed monodevelop, but I dont know what to do now?
You need to run the configure script and then type "make" in the console window
how?
do you know how to open up a terminal?
yep, and I know sudo
ok go to the dir where monodevelop was installed and you should find a configure script
You will type ./configure and run the script and then when it's finished, type make
I installed with apt-get install monodevelop shouldn't the program be ready to go then?
if it was installed through synaptic, there would be a menu entry for it
